DOC.brief_title: Intravenous Fluid Therapy Treatment Emergency Department Patients With Migraine Headache
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator intend perform small-scale pilot study assess effectiveness IV fluid therapy patient present ED migraine headache . Patients randomly allocate receive bolus 1000 ml normal saline fluid bolus . Patients outcome assessor blind assigned study group . Research assistants assess pain score , nausea , functional disability time 0 ( prior start intervention ) , 60 minute , 120 minute . Participants contact 48 hour leave ED ass symptom burden follow discharge .
DOC.criteria: Age 18 old Fluent English Meets International Classification Headache Disorders ( 3rd ed ) criterion migraine headache : A . At least five attack fulfil criterion BD B. Headache attack last 472 hour ( untreated unsuccessfully treat ) C. Headache least two follow four characteristic : unilateral location pulsate quality moderate severe pain intensity aggravation cause avoidance routine physical activity ( e.g . walk climb stair ) D. During headache least one following : 1. nausea and/or vomit 2. photophobia phonophobia E. Not well account another ICHD3 diagnosis . Intravenous Fluids contraindicate opinion emergency department physician caring patient ( ex patient exacerbation congestive heart failure ) . Intravenous fluid require opinion emergency department physician caring patient ( ex patient intractable vomiting , patient severe dehydration ) .
